data.title: National governing bodies in Colorado Springs
data.meta_description: A thumbnail look at the national governing bodies in Colorado Springs.
data.text:
USA Archery

usaarchery.org

- Summer Olympics and Paralympics

- The headquarters is at 4065 Sinton Road.

- Denise Parker is the chief executive officer.

- The men's Summer Olympic team has won eight gold medals, three silvers and two bronzes since its first Olympics in 1904. The women have claimed two golds and three bronzes.

- The last Olympic archery medals came in 2000 when Richard "Butch" Johnson, Rod White and Vic Wunderle took the team bronze. White also won an individual silver medal.

USA Badminton

usabadminton.org

- Summer Olympics

- Headquarters is at 1 Olympic Plaza.

- Dan Cloppas is the CEO and secretary general.

- Badminton is a relatively new Olympic sport. It was a demonstration sport at the 1972 Munich Olympics. Badminton eventually became an Olympic sport in Barcelona in 1992. Only the singles and doubles were introduced for the first time in the Olympic Games. Mixed doubles was included in the 1996 Atlanta Games, and badminton is the only sport that has a mixed doubles event in the Olympics. Only five countries have won gold medals at the Olympics since badminton was introduced in 1992 - China, Indonesia, Korea, England and Denmark.

USA Basketball

usabasketball.com

- Summer Olympics and Paralympics

- Headquarters is at 5465 Mark Dabling Blvd.

- Jerry Colangelo is the chairman of the board of directors; Jim Tooley is the executive director.

- The USA men have captured the gold in 14 of the 17 Olympics they have competed in and compiled a 130-5 record. The USA women have earned the gold in five consecutive Olympics and have a 50-3 record.

- USA Basketball announced at the end of July that it will be moving its headquarters to Tempe, Ariz. The organization will have a new headquarters and basketball training center built adjacent to the Arizona State University campus.

- USA Basketball has made Colorado Springs home since 1978.

USA Boxing

usaboxing.org

- Summer Olympics

- Headquarters is at 1 Olympic Plaza.

- Anthony Bartkowski is the executive director.

- Boxing was first included in the Olympics in 1904. Since that time, U.S. boxers have won 111 Olympic medals: 49 gold, 23 silver and 39 bronze, which leads the all-time medal count.

- Women's boxing made its Olympic debut at the 2012 London Games. Team USA won two medals in the debut of the sport with 17-year-old phenom Claressa Shields taking the first gold medal in the women's middleweight division and flyweight Marlen Esparza claiming bronze.

USA Cycling

usacycling.org

- Summer Olympics and Paralympics

- Headquarters is at 210 USA Cycling Point.

- Steve Johnson is the president and chief executive officer.

- Cycling has been in the Olympics since the first modern-day Games in Athens in 1896. The United States has medaled 26 times and has won seven golds.

USA Fencing

usfencing.org

- Summer Olympics and Paralympics

- Headquarters is at 1 Olympic Plaza.

- Donald Anthony Jr. is the president and chairman of the board of directors.

- Fencing is one of only five sports that has been featured at every modern-day Olympic Games since the first in Athens in 1896.

- USA Fencing has been in Colorado Springs since 1982.

USA Field Hockey

usafieldhockey.org

- Summer Olympics

- Headquarters is at 1 Olympic Plaza.

- Steve Locke is the executive director.

- The U.S. men's team has taken home just one Olympic medal, a bronze in 1932. While men's field hockey was first played in the Olympic Games in 1908, women's field hockey made its debut in 1980. The U.S. women have also won one medal with a bronze in Los Angeles in 1984.

U.S. Figure Skating

usfigureskating.org

- Winter Olympics

- Headquarters is at 20 First St.

- Patricia St. Peter is the president.

- Team USA has won at least one medal in 17 consecutive Winter Olympics, dating to 1948. U.S. figure skaters have won 46 medals in all, more than any other country.

USA Hockey

usahockey.com

- Winter Olympics and Paralympics

- Headquarters is at 1175 Bob Johnson Drive.

- Dave Ogrean is the executive director.

- United States men have won 11 Olympic ice hockey medals, including two golds. Men's hockey began in 1920, and women joined the Olympic fray in 1998. The U.S. women have medaled at every Olympics since, including a gold when women's hockey debuted.

USA Judo

usjudo.org

- Summer Olympics and Paralympics

- Headquarters is at 1 Olympic Plaza.

- Jose Rodriguez is the chief executive officer.

- Judo became an Olympic sport for men in 1964. Women were allowed to compete in 1992. Since that time, the United States has won 11 Olympic medals. Kayla Harrison won the United States' first gold medal at the 2012 Londaon Games.

USA Pentathlon

Teamusa.org/USA-Modern- Pentathlon

- Summer Olympics

- Headquarters is at 1 Olympic Plaza.

- Rob Stull is the managing director.

USA Shooting

usashooting.org

- Summer Olympics

- Headquarters is at 1 Olympic Plaza.

- Gary Anderson is the president; Robert Mitchell is the executive director.

- USA Shooting has a great Olympic tradition winning 106 total medals since 1896. The men and women are just one away from boasting 50 total golds. USA won three medals in the 2012 London Games, including two golds.

USA Swimming

usaswimming.org

- Summer Olympics and Paralympics

- Headquarters is at 1 Olympic Plaza.

- Chuck Wielgus is the executive director.

- The United States is an annual powerhouse in Olympic swimming. Team USA has won more than 500 total medals, including more than 200 golds.

USA Table Tennis

usatt.org

- Summer Olympics and Paralympics

- Headquarters is at 711 N. Tejon St.

- Michael Babuin is the chairman.

- The United States has never won an Olympic medal in table tennis. China has dominated the sport, winning the vast majority of medals since the sport debuted at the 1988 Games in Seoul, South Korea.

USA Taekwondo

usa-taekwondo.us

- Summer Olympics

- Headquarters is at 1 Olympic Plaza.

- Bruce Harris is the interim chief executive officer.

- The United States is one of three countries with three taekwondo medals since the sport joined the Olympic Games in 2000. Team USA has two golds and a bronze.

USA Team Handball

usateamhandball.org

- Summer Olympics

- Headquarters is in Colorado Springs.

- Matt Van Houten is the chief executive officer.

- Team Handball was first played in the Olympics in 1936. Women didn't join the fray until 1976. The United States has never won a medal in the sport.

USA Triathlon

usatriathlon.org

- Summer Olympics

- Headquarters is at 1365 Garden of the Gods Road.

- Bob Wendling is the president.

- Susan Williams is the only USA medalist in Olympic triathlon competition. Williams won a bronze in 2004, just the sport's second Olympiad as it debuted in 2000.

USA Volleyball

usavolleyball.org

- Summer Olympics and Paralympics

- Headquarters is at 4065 Sinton Road.

- Doug Beal is the chief executive officer.

- The men's and women's indoor volleyball teams have each claimed one gold medal in the Olympic Games. Both came in 1984 in Los Angeles. The United States found its niche in Olympic volleyball in 1996 when beach volleyball was added. Since then U.S. tandems have won six gold medals, three for the men and another three on the women's side.

USA Weightlifting

usaweightlifting.org

- Summer Olympics

- Headquarters is at 1 Olympic Plaza.

- Michael Massik is the chief executive officer.

- Team USA owns 11 weightlifting gold medals. The men have not won an Olympic title since 1956, but Colorado Springs' Tara Nott claimed the only gold for the women's team when she won the flyweight division in 2000, the first time women's weightlifting was an Olympic sport.

USA Wrestling

themat.com

- Summer Olympics

- Headquarters is at 6155 Lehman Drive.

- Rich Bender is the executive director.

- Wrestling was eliminated after 2016 as an Olympic sport in February and had to go through a grueling process of revamping its sport's rules and leadership. On Sept. 8, the sport that dates back to about 700 B.C. was reinstated for the 2020 Games.

- Wrestling has been a part of the modern Olympics since 1896. Since that time, only one other country has more medals than the United States. Team USA has 125 total medals, including 50 golds.

Pan American sports

Colorado Springs is also home to the headquarters of USA Karate and USA Racquetball. Both are not Olympic sports but compete in the Pan American Games.
